summary: This document is a transcript of a grand jury proceeding regarding the superseding indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell. The prosecutor presents corrections to clerical errors in the original indictment related to perjury charges, without introducing new evidence or witnesses.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged in a six-count indictment, with corrections being made to perjury counts related to her deposition testimony.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to the case, indicating his connection to the charges against Maxwell.

persons.name: FBI Special Agent
persons.context: Testified during the grand jury proceedings, though the name is not specified in this transcript.

connections.description: Implied connection through the case, with Epstein being mentioned in the context of the charges against Maxwell.

events.title: Maxwell's Deposition Testimony
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell gave deposition testimony in a civil case, which is referenced in the perjury charges.

events.title: Maxwell's Second Deposition Testimony
events.description: Second instance of deposition testimony by Maxwell, also referenced in the perjury charges.

events.title: Grand Jury Proceeding
events.description: Proceeding to present a superseding indictment correcting clerical errors in the original charges against Maxwell.

locations.context: Location of the United States Courthouse where the grand jury proceeding took place.

keyFacts: The document details corrections to clerical errors in the indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell, specifically related to perjury charges.
The superseding indictment does not introduce new evidence or witnesses, focusing solely on correcting typographical errors.
The grand jury was instructed to base their decision solely on the evidence presented, disregarding any outside information about the case.
The case involves references to Jeffrey Epstein, indicating his connection to the charges against Maxwell.
The document underscores the procedural aspects of grand jury deliberations and the importance of accurate legal documentation.
